p.s: The given excerpt (p. 84 l. 1 - p. 87 l. 28) of chapter five from the novel The Great Gatsby, written by F. Scott Fitzgerald and published in 1925, deals with the first reunion of Gatsby and Daisy, and how it affects Gatsby's behaviour.
After being invited by Nick to come over to his house, Daisy arrives.
After taking a short walk around the house while she arrives, Gatsby knocks, enters and meets Daisy after five years.
There is an awkward silence between them both, so Nick offers to make tea.
The scene continues in the kitchen, and after a short private conversation between Nick and Gatsby, Nick proceeds to also take a walk, so that Daisy and Gatsby can be alone.
When he comes back in, the mood has shifted from embarrassment to joy.
Lastly, Gatsby suggests that all three of them come over to his house.
